fields.description:
{panel:bgColor=#e7f4fa}
  *NOTE:* This bug report is for *Confluence Cloud*. Using *Confluence Server*? [See the corresponding bug report|http://jira.atlassian.com/browse/CONFSERVER-46638].
  {panel}

If you run an api call like this:
curl -H "content-type: application/json" -X POST -d '{"tag":["jira"],"sort":"added_at","reverse":"true"}' -L 'https://answers.atlassian.com/api/search/'

You'd expect that you'd get the latest 5 questions. Instead, you get the first five questions, in the reversed order.

We either need a new parameter or we need 'reverse' to reverse the set before the default offset and limit are applied.

The only workaround is to call the search, find out the number of results, and set the offset manually.

From Chris Miller's post:
(https://answers.atlassian.com/questions/181552/atlassian-answers-search-by-recent-not-picking-up-recent-entries)

Hello,

For about a month the answers page has stopped updating "most recent entries" on my keyword search I use as a default. For example, I work at Zephyr, so have the following URL string as a saved tab when I open my browser: https://answers.atlassian.com/search/?sort=recent&q=Zephyr&t=question

The most recent entry that populates is from April 1.

However the email triggers I have set continue to work fine, and my team can continue to pick up more recent entries like the following.

https://answers.atlassian.com/questions/179777/can-we-change-the-image-for-test-cycles-folder?page=1#181506

The above doesn't appear in my search results, though I would expect it.

Chris

fields.description:
{panel:bgColor=#e7f4fa}
  *NOTE:* This bug report is for *Confluence Cloud*. Using *Confluence Server*? [See the corresponding bug report|http://jira.atlassian.com/browse/CONFSERVER-46604].
  {panel}

h4. Background
[~zverev.vasiliy35530848045926] noticed this issue on Atlassian Answers and posted a new question when he couldn't proceed -- [https://answers.atlassian.com/questions/35772255]. It seems he's using an invalid URL because the ID of the Answer in the URL doesn't match content on the Question in question.

This is an issue because accessing Confluence Questions via an invalid link may not be a common problem, but it's easy to accidentally append or subtract a single letter from a URL when copy-pasting. This may be more widespread than we think.

When navigating to non-existant Questions, we get a message that the Question doesn't exist. When navigating to non-existant Comments on an actual Question, there is no issue. When navigating to non-existant Answers on an actual Question, we have a problem.

h4. Steps to reproduce
Click the following URL to an answer on Atlassian Answers: https://answers.atlassian.com/questions/35762363/answers/35771303

This URL is referencing two pieces of content -- 
# *Question* 35762363
# *Answer* 35771303

h4. Expected results
* The question (35762363) should load
* The answer (35771303) should be highlighted
* All page content should load properly

h4. Actual results
* The question (35762363) loads
* The answer is not highlighted
* The answer is of a different ID than one would expect from the URL (*{color:red}35763985{color}*)
* The sidebar of 'related questions' does not render (see image) \\  !image-2016-02-03-21-55-29-312.png|thumbnail! 
* Comment and Answer editors do not load (see image) \\ !image-2016-02-03-22-00-34-378.png|thumbnail! 
* The following line is added to the browser console when clicking inside of an editor \\ {noformat}Bootstrap:initialise: No settings found. Has preInitialise been called?{noformat}
fields.summary: Unable to load all content when accessing CQ via a URL that references a nonexistent answer

After upgrading to the last version of CQ I noticed the following problem:
when one of the question lists "Popular", "Recent" or "Unanswered" is initially displayed and I scroll down to the bottom of the list, the automatic loading of more questions doesn't take place. The "Show more" link isn't shown, either.

After reloading the page one or two times using F5, the behavior changes back to normal and I can see more questions on scrolling or by using the "Show more" link.

This is browser independent, i.e. the same in IE 11, FF and Chrome.

fields.description:
{panel:bgColor=#e7f4fa}
  *NOTE:* This bug report is for *Confluence Cloud*. Using *Confluence Server*? [See the corresponding bug report|http://jira.atlassian.com/browse/CONFSERVER-46588].
  {panel}

CQ appears to be waiting for a lock that is locked by the index, which is currently trying to process a large amount of updates.
{code}
"http-nio-8081-exec-3" #252 daemon prio=5 os_prio=0 tid=0x00007f8bbc15e800 nid=0x1f91 waiting on condition [0x00007f8930951000]
   java.lang.Thread.State: WAITING (parking)
        at sun.misc.Unsafe.park(Native Method)
        - parking to wait for  <0x00000005e0802508> (a java.util.concurrent.locks.ReentrantLock$NonfairSync)
        at java.util.concurrent.locks.LockSupport.park(LockSupport.java:175)
...
        at com.atlassian.bonnie.LoggingReentrantLock.lock(LoggingReentrantLock.java:32)
        at com.atlassian.bonnie.LuceneConnection.withWriter(LuceneConnection.java:483)
{code}

The thread 'http-nio-8081-exec-3 is a doeditquestion.action:

||Thread ID||       Thread name||                  User ID||         Type                 ||Summary||                                                         Duration||
|252|                 http-nio-8081-exec-3|      amckague     |web-request|     /cq/doeditquestion.action?id=2669904138|     1 hour, 16 minutes, 20 seconds|

The only threads that are getting stuck are CQ threads (see screenshot). Why would we be blocking on a Lucene lock in CQ?

!cq stuck requests.png|height=450px!

{panel:bgColor=#e7f4fa}
  *NOTE:* This bug report is for *Confluence Cloud*. Using *Confluence Server*? [See the corresponding bug report|http://jira.atlassian.com/browse/CONFSERVER-46572].
  {panel}

h3. Summary

500 error when attempting to Share a Confluence Cloud Question post. Visible error of ! Error Sending

h3. Environment

* Confluence Version: 1000.14.0 
* Tested on Chrome: Version 49.0.2623.110 (64-bit)
* Tested on Safari: Version 9.1 (11601.5.17.1)

h3. Steps to Reproduce
# Log into Confluence instance
# Questions > Select any question
# Top Right: Share > Type a name of any user/group > Add note > hit Share
# ! Error Sending

h3. Expected Results

To be able to share Confluence Question post without any errors.

h3. Actual Results

! Error Sending

Confluence Cloud log:
{code}
2016-04-12 20:01:39.083935500 2016-04-12 20:01:39,080 ERROR [http-bio-2007-exec-30] [common.error.jersey.ThrowableExceptionMapper] toResponse Uncaught exception thrown by REST service: null
2016-04-12 20:01:39.083938500  -- referer: https://<EXAMPLE INSTANCE NAME>.atlassian.net/wiki/questions/3637269/how-do-i-edit-a-commit-message-in-git | url: /wiki/rest/share-page/latest/share | traceId: 46d431d3ee83e822 | userName: sysadmin
2016-04-12 20:01:39.083939500 java.lang.NullPointerException
2016-04-12 20:01:39.083940500 	at com.atlassian.confluence.plugins.sharepage.api.SharePageServiceImpl.sharePage(SharePageServiceImpl.java:229)
2016-04-12 20:01:39.083981500 	at com.atlassian.confluence.plugins.sharepage.api.SharePageServiceImpl.share(SharePageServiceImpl.java:210)
2016-04-12 20:01:39.083982500 	at com.atlassian.confluence.plugins.sharepage.rest.ShareResource.share(ShareResource.java:34)
2016-04-12 20:01:39.083982500 	at sun.reflect.NativeMethodAccessorImpl.invoke0(Native Method)
2016-04-12 20:01:39.083983500 	at sun.reflect.NativeMethodAccessorImpl.invoke(NativeMethodAccessorImpl.java:62)
2016-04-12 20:01:39.083992500 	at sun.reflect.DelegatingMethodAccessorImpl.invoke(DelegatingMethodAccessorImpl.java:43)
2016-04-12 20:01:39.083993500 	at java.lang.reflect.Method.invoke(Method.java:498)
{code}
 
Reproducible in several different cloud instances. 

h3. Notes

Step taken:
* Disabling and re-enabling the Share Page Plugin 
* Stop Confluence Service
* Built indexes from scratch
{noformat}
rm -rf /confluence/home/index/*
rm -rf /confluence/home/bundled-plugins

fields.description:
{panel:bgColor=#e7f4fa}
  *NOTE:* This suggestion is for *Confluence Cloud*. Using *Confluence Server*? [See the corresponding suggestion|http://jira.atlassian.com/browse/CONFSERVER-46556].
  {panel}

h3. Summary
Copy and paste (using keyboard shortcut or mouse right button > copy and paste) of files in Confluence doesn't work, drag and drop or clicking the insert image top button works fine.

h3. Steps to Reproduce
# Select a file in the computer
# Click with the right button of your mouse, select copy click on the page select paste
## Drag and drop seems to work fine, clicking on the "Insert files or images" at the top of the toolbar works too.

h3. Expected Results
The page will present a popup with the uploading progress of the attachment.

h3. Actual Results
Firefox 51.0.1 - Drag and drop works, copy and paste doesn't work and brings a sample png
Chrome 56.0.2924.87 - Drag and drop works, copy and paste doesn't work and brings file name only eg: sample.jpg
Safari 9.1.2 - Drag and drop works, copy and paste brings the local path of the file to the page  e.g: file://Userdirectory/folder/file.jpg
 
h3. Notes

Nothing relevant on the logs.

Copying and paste or drag and dropping the file from the Sketch editor doesn't work in Chrome.

h3.Workaround
Use the "Insert files or images" button to open the file navigator on the computer. Then, select a file and proceed with the upload of the attachment, drag and drop a file from a folder into the page seems to work.
fields.summary: Copy and paste of attachments not working in Confluence

fields.description:
{panel:bgColor=#e7f4fa}
  *NOTE:* This suggestion is for *Confluence Cloud*. Using *Confluence Server*? [See the corresponding suggestion|http://jira.atlassian.com/browse/CONFSERVER-46555].
  {panel}

h3. Problem Definition

Some customers would access Atlassian Cloud application within their corporate network. If some domains that are needed by Confluence are blocked by their firewall or proxy, the application will not work properly on the client. 

 

Suggested Solution

Create a guideline on what domains should be accessible within corporate networks for Confluence to work properly (i.e. for images, css, cdn, etc..).
h3. Why this is important

This is important to help network administrators set up their network to allow access to Confluence on cloud.
fields.summary: Documentation guidelines for accessing cloud instances

  {panel}

h3. Summary

On Internet Explorer and Firefox, when you have the attachments macro in the body of the page and you click the Edit in Office button it show an error instead of opening it in Office.
h3. Environment

Confluence Cloud. Tested on Windows 7 + IE11 and Firefox 51.0.1 (32-bit).
h3. Steps to Reproduce
 # Add the Attachments macro to a page
 # Attach an Office file to this page (tested here with a xlsx file)
 # Click the Edit in Office button within the Attachments macro

h3. Expected Results

The file opens in Office directly.

fields.description:
{panel:bgColor=#e7f4fa}
  *NOTE:* This suggestion is for *Confluence Cloud*. Using *Confluence Server*? [See the corresponding suggestion|http://jira.atlassian.com/browse/CONFSERVER-46544].
  {panel}

This is a request from the customer to improve the SSL implementation steps related to CA certificate. In this case, they provided steps for the StartSSL CA.

The customer faced some issues during the integration with Hipchat and created a guideline.

Steps:
{quote}
IMPORTANT: private key and keystore password need to be the SAME. If not then you need to specifiy the password for the private key *6)
1) Create CSR and private key on your linux box:
openssl req -newkey rsa:2048 -keyout private.key -out request.csr -subj "/C=na/ST=None/L=None/O=None/CN=None"
2) Create certificate with the generated CSR for your domain. (in StartSSL go to "Certificates Wizard", paste the generated CSR for your domain and submit. Download and extract the certificate and CA Chain.)
3) Create PFX file from certificate (step 2), private key (step 1) and Certificate Chain (step 2 - root bundle or intermediate cert depending on CA):
openssl pkcs12 -export -out <PFX-filename>.pfx -inkey private.key -in <your-certificate>.crt -certfile <CA-chain-file>.crt
(you can use the same password for the PFX file as for the private key to make things easier - we won't need the PFX file later and can destroy it)
The output should read like this:
>Enter pass phrase for private.key:
>Enter Export Password:
>Verifying - Enter Export Password:
4) Convert the PFX into a Java keystore. In your JRE bin directory on your linux box execute:
./keytool -importkeystore -srckeystore <PFX-filename>.pfx -destkeystore <new-keystore-file>.keystore -srcstoretype PKCS12 -deststoretype JKS
IMPORTANT: Use the SAME PASSWORD for the keystore as for the private key from step 1)! otherwise see *6)
The output should read like this:
>Enter destination keystore password:
>Re-enter new password:
>Enter source keystore password:
>Entry for alias 1 successfully imported.
>Import command completed:  1 entries successfully imported, 0 entries failed or cancelled
5)Edit your server.xml, uncomment the <Connector port="8443> and point the keystore entry to your <new-keystore>.keystore and supply the keystore password from step 1. (keystoreFile="<new-keystore>.keystore" keystorePass="<password from step 1>")
*6) If you want to set different passwords for the private key and the keystore then you have to:
./keytool -keypasswd -keystore /path/to/keyestore.file -alias <alias-in-keystore>
If you're not sure about the alias: ./keytool -list -keystore <name-of-keystore>
*7) Alternative to creating a PFX file including the CA chain file:
./keytool -importcert -alias startssl-CA-chain -keystore <path-to-atlassian-directory>/jre/lib/security/cacerts -file <CA Chain Cert in PEM format>.crt
{quote}
fields.summary: SSL documentation improve request for CA SSL

fields.description:
{panel:bgColor=#e7f4fa}
  *NOTE:* This suggestion is for *Confluence Cloud*. Using *Confluence Server*? [See the corresponding suggestion|http://jira.atlassian.com/browse/CONFSERVER-46537].
  {panel}

h3. Problem Definition
The *Add Page* space permission is what grants users the ability to reorder pages in Confluence. There are cases where users should be able to add pages, but not have the ability to reorder pages in a space. Moreover, when page restrictions are in place for hierarchies in a space, users who are restricted from seeing other hierarchies have the ability to reorder pages of restricted hierarchies, even though they cannot edit them. 

This poses an issue for proper documentation, as users can easily move pages, even if they are restricted from editing. A similar feature request was submitted (CONF-24901), but was marked as incomplete. 

h3. Suggested Solution
There are two ways around this: 
# Create a separate space permission for *Reorder page*.
# Create a new page restriction that denies everyone from moving pages in the hierarchy, except for select users or groups. 

Out of the two, number 1 would likely be best.

h3. Why this is important
This is important because users should be able to add pages without having the ability to completely transform the hierarchy of a space. 

h3. Workaround 
There is no real workaround. That said, you can create separate spaces for different hierarchies so that only users who should be able to reorder pages can do so in their own space without affecting other hierarchies in the original space.
fields.summary: Provide the ability to add pages without also granting reorder page permissions

fields.description:
{panel:bgColor=#e7f4fa}
  *NOTE:* This suggestion is for *Confluence Cloud*. Using *Confluence Server*? [See the corresponding suggestion|http://jira.atlassian.com/browse/CONFSERVER-46520].
  {panel}

When someone that I follow likes a comment, I get an email notification with the content of the comment, a link to the context of the comment, and the name of the person who liked it. This is very useful.

However, one important bit of information missing: the author of the comment. As I'm quickly scanning through liked  comments in my email notifications, I'd really like to know who made these insightful comments without having to click through.

h3.Steps 

 # Someone I follow likes a comment.
 # I get an email notification about the like. I read it directmy in the email, while I'm off the Atlassian network. I'm impressed by the comment and start thinking about how I could respond... And I realise I need to know who wrote it in order to write a considerate response.
 # I scan the notification for the author, bit it isn't there. I have to join the VPN, click through the notification to find the author, by which time my flow is broken.


 *What should have happened...*

 # Someone I follow likes a comment.
 # I get an email notification about the like, which includes not just the name of the liker and the body of the comment, but also the author of the comment.
fields.summary: It'd be great if email notifications about someone liking a comment showed who authored the comment

fields.description:
{panel:bgColor=#e7f4fa}
  *NOTE:* This suggestion is for *Confluence Cloud*. Using *Confluence Server*? [See the corresponding suggestion|http://jira.atlassian.com/browse/CONFSERVER-46512].
  {panel}

I documented issue here on the forum but no action or response was seen.

[https://answers.atlassian.com/questions/43904592/fail2ban-advice-looks-wrong]

The advice [https://confluence.atlassian.com/doc/using-fail2ban-to-limit-login-attempts-216433031.html] is incorrect.

 


Because Confluence lacks a CSRF token on the login box.
Because the advice suggests tracking "GET /login.action"

But there is no need to "GET /login.action" to log into Confluence, so tracking it is of zero value as a defence mechanism.

The advice should suggest "POST /dologin.action" as a minimum (the authentication people may know of other URLs that need to be included).

Confluence should consider adding a CSRF prevention token to the login form, so that you must fetch the login form before logging in.
fields.summary: The website security advice on fail2ban is wrong

h3. Problem statement
At the moment, if you want to search for Confluence Questions via the search bar at the top, you have to manually click on 'Custom' > 'Questions' underneath the 'Of type' heading.

h3. Suggestion
Add 'Questions' underneath 'Of type' alongside pages, blogposts, attachments, etc. so it is easier for users to do the search.

 !Questions Of Type.png|thumbnail!

I've got an automated analysis task that produces a very large amount of data daily, and I would like to present this data as an interactive page on Confluence.

The data is in the form of xml reports, and I plan to make these human readable via css/xslt.

It appears I can embed external content via the html/iframe widget, however I can't get it to work with any of the obvious hosting options available. I've tried google drive, teamspace, and SVN. Google drive doesn't appear allow raw content access via javascript, and svn and teamspace have cross site scripting disabled.

It would be good for Confluence to incorporate something that allows for this functionality.

fields.description:
{panel:bgColor=#e7f4fa}
  *NOTE:* This suggestion is for *Confluence Cloud*. Using *Confluence Server*? [See the corresponding suggestion|http://jira.atlassian.com/browse/CONFSERVER-46420].
  {panel}

h3. Problem Definition

Currently, the 'user email visibility' security setting is global to all wiki spaces on a Confluence platform.
Some of our wikis administrators are requesting for enabling 'visibility' and other ones request for disabling.
h3. Suggested Solution

Create a new Visibility for emails, for example, set this to work with space/groups of users.
Instead of having a global setting, would it be possible to set this parameter:
 * either per space
 * either per groups of users

h3. Why this is important

So we can set the email visibility accordingly to each user needs
fields.summary: User email visibility set by groups/space
